channel.title: [PI] Membership Questions
channel.description:
I am starting to add a Membership system, and I just finished the client sided part, but I have this problem.
When I log in, I am still wiedling the members items and all the bonuses are same, how can I make it remove and make the bonuses to 0, if you're not a member.

item.title: [PI] Membership Questions
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“DAn0194, post:33, topic:524879”][quote author=matzie link=topic=643573.msg4333814#msg4333814 date=1374034423]
The point i gave him my code for.

Where it loads the bonuses…

if (item.isMembers())
continue;
else
playerBonus[currentBonus]+=theBonus;

or was that too hard to figure out alone?
[/quote]

That’s a good head start, like matzie said in your initialize method where it writes your bonuses just make it check if your in a members world or free world.

Good luck :D[/quote]
It is the server that tells the client if it is a members world or not anyways.
Weather or not to show Members Item for the names is up to the server, unless its customized client that doesnt do that anymore.

Read full topic

[quote=“matzie, post:32, topic:524879”]The point i gave him my code for.

Where it loads the bonuses…

if (item.isMembers())
continue;
else
playerBonus[currentBonus]+=theBonus;

or was that too hard to figure out alone?[/quote]

That’s a good head start, like matzie said in your initialize method where it writes your bonuses just make it check if your in a members world or free world.

Good luck

item.title: [PI] Membership Questions
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

Driman Rune:

sorry but i get errors.

oh shit errors, time to give up. If i was you, i would learn how to program in java before trying to make a private server. if you can’t figure out simple errors (Especially if it has to do with the package…) you are never going to get anywhere. Use a little common sense and you might make it out on your own. i vote this thread be locked because ignorance is not the answer to everything.

and of course if you try adding my code blatently without any modifications you will of course get errors. i did not give you my who Constants file because well, you dont need getXPForLevel and shit like that!
I gave you what you needed to accomplish the task at hand, and you need to put your big boy/girl pants on and do something about it.


probably shouldn’t of used such a cute baby…

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Membership Questions
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

Give me 5 minutes and i will get you my code from the source i am writing, you will be on your own to implement it.

To get an Item, use the loadItem(itemid) method.
To check if it is members, use the ItemDef returned and call isMembers() from it.
Constants.java
Initializer:

[code] static {
java.io.File file = null;
java.io.FileInputStream fis = null;
try {
file = new java.io.File("./data/itemdata.dat");
fis = new java.io.FileInputStream(file);

    } catch (java.io.FileNotFoundException fnfe) {
        System.exit(0);
    }
    itemStream = new Stream(new byte[(int) file.length()]);
    try {
        fis.read(itemStream.buffer);
    } catch (java.io.IOException ioe) {
    }
    try {
        label1:
        while (true) {

            int tok = itemStream.readUnsignedByte();
            label0:
            switch (tok) {
                case 0:
                    break label0;
                case 1:
                    int id = itemStream.readUnsignedWord();
                    itemArrayIndex[id] = itemStream.currentOffset - 3; //itemID
                    break label0;
                case 2:
                    itemStream.readString();
                    break label0;
                case 3:
                    itemStream.readString();
                    break label0;
                case 4:
                case 5:
                case 6:
                case 7:
                case 8:
                    itemStream.readString();
                    break label0;
                case 9:
                    break label0;
                case 10:
                    break label0;
                case 11:
                    break label0;
                case 12:
                    itemStream.readDWord();
                    break label0;
                case 255:
                    System.out.println("Finished init");
                    break label1;
                default:
                    System.out.println("err");
                    break label1;
            }

        }

        fis.close();
    } catch (Exception e) {
    }
}[/code]

needed variables:

private final static Stream itemStream; public final static int[] itemArrayIndex = new int[8000];

[code] public static ItemDef loadItem(int id) {
ItemDef itemdef = new ItemDef();
itemStream.currentOffset = itemArrayIndex[id];
if (itemStream.currentOffset < 0) {
return new ItemDef();
}
label1:

    while (true) {

        int tok = itemStream.readUnsignedByte();
        label0:
        switch (tok) {
            case 0:
                return itemdef;
            case 1:
                itemdef.setID(itemStream.readUnsignedWord());//itemID
                break label0;
            case 2:
                itemdef.setName(itemStream.readString());
                break label0;
            case 3:
                itemdef.setDesc(itemStream.readString());
                break label0;
            case 4:
            case 5:
            case 6:
            case 7:
            case 8:

                itemdef.setAction(tok - 4, itemStream.readString());
                break label0;
            case 9:
                itemdef.setStackable(true);
                break label0;
            case 10:
                itemdef.setMembers(true);
                break label0;
            case 11:
                itemdef.setNotes(true);
                break label0;
            case 12:
                itemdef.setValue(itemStream.readDWord());
                break label0;
            case 255:
                System.out.println("End of file");
                break label1;
            default:
                System.out.println("error reading" + tok);
                break label1;
        }

    }
    return null;

}[/code]

ItemDef.java

[code]package scratchserver;

public class ItemDef {

private int itemID;
private int value;
private String itemName;
private String itemDesc;
private String[] actions = new String[5];
private boolean stackable, notes;
private boolean members;

public ItemDef() {
    itemID = -1;
    itemName = "";
    itemDesc = "";
    actions = null;
    stackable = false;
    members = false;
    notes = false;
    value = -1;

}

public ItemDef(int id) {
    itemID = id;
    itemName = "";
    itemDesc = "";
    actions = null;
    stackable = false;
    members = false;
    notes = false;
    value = 0;
}
public ItemDef setID(int id) {
    itemID = id;
    return this;
}
public ItemDef setName(String name) {
    itemName = name;
    return this;
}

public ItemDef setDesc(String desc) {
    itemDesc = desc;
    return this;
}

public ItemDef setStackable(boolean bool) {
    stackable = bool;
    return this;
}

public ItemDef setValue(int val) {
    value = val;
    return this;
}

public ItemDef setNotes(boolean bool) {
    notes = bool;
    return this;
}

public ItemDef setMembers(boolean bool) {
    members = bool;
    return this;
}

public ItemDef setAction(int slot, String x) {
    if (actions == null) {
        actions = new String[5];
    }
    actions[slot] = x;
    return this;
}

public int getID() {
    return itemID;
}

public String getName() {
    return itemName;
}

public String getDesc() {
    return itemDesc;
}

public boolean validateAction(int actionSlot, String actionName) {
    if (actions == null) {
        return false;
    }
    return actions[actionSlot].equalsIgnoreCase(actionName);
}

public String getNthAction(int n) {//n[1-5]
    if (actions == null) {
        return "null";
    }
    if (n - 1 >= actions.length) {
        return "null";
    }
    return actions[n - 1];
}

public boolean isWeapon() {
    if (getNthAction(2).equalsIgnoreCase("Wield")) {
        return true;
    }
    return false;
}

public boolean isArmour() {
    if (getNthAction(2).equalsIgnoreCase("Wear")) {
        return true;
    }
    return false;
}

public boolean isStackable() {
    return stackable;
}

public int getValue() {
    return value;
}

public boolean isNotes() {
    return notes;
}

public boolean isMembers() {
    return members;
}

public void printDebug() {
    System.out.println(getID() + "\t" + getName() + "\t\t\t" + isStackable() + "\t" + isMembers() + "\t" + value);
}

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Membership Questions
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:17, topic:524879”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=643573.msg4332255#msg4332255 date=1373828903]

[quote author=arham 4 link=topic=643573.msg4332252#msg4332252 date=1373828682]

[quote author=Vain_ link=topic=643573.msg4331848#msg4331848 date=1373755372]

Thanks Mate, makes more sense,

If you can give me an example, or what your saying it will save me a heck a lot of time
[/quote]look at how item definitions are loaded from the client. then streamed to the server.

do it for ‘membersObject’ and then check it server sided.

@arham; would be pointless to do; as it would only remove the item (and he’d have to add an array/list/map of some sort using all the ‘member item’ ids.)

Custom packet to send the members objects ids. And then

If statement in the initialize method.

[size=1pt]As you can tell, I am just blindly saying stuff[/size]
[/quote]according to the wiki, no packet exists in the protocol to stream the membership items. also; if there was: where would it pull the data from? either from a user-generated array like i said would need to be created, or from the cache’s item definitions (which is what i said to do, read data from cache > stream to server. | or just add the cache to the server and read it server sided.

So should I just edit the file the items.txt are from and do this"

if (c.member) = true;
blah blah(“data/playeractions/items.txt”);
else if (c.member) = false;
blah blah("data/playeractions/freetoplayitems.txt);

something like that???
[/quote]if you’re creating two worlds, you don’t need 2 files.

member worlds: item configuration contains bonuses for all items.
free worlds: item configuration contains only bonuses for free-to-play items

members flag is sent upon login, item definitions have a members flag, there should not be any more modifications needed other than bonuses.[/quote]

Not like anyone seems to use it any ways, playerRights is used for almost ever rank even for membership type of ranks…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:15, topic:524879”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=643573.msg4332252#msg4332252 date=1373828682]

Thanks Mate, makes more sense,

If you can give me an example, or what your saying it will save me a heck a lot of time
[/quote]look at how item definitions are loaded from the client. then streamed to the server.

do it for ‘membersObject’ and then check it server sided.

@arham; would be pointless to do; as it would only remove the item (and he’d have to add an array/list/map of some sort using all the ‘member item’ ids.)

Custom packet to send the members objects ids. And then

If statement in the initialize method.

[size=1pt]As you can tell, I am just blindly saying stuff[/size]
[/quote]according to the wiki, no packet exists in the protocol to stream the membership items. also; if there was: where would it pull the data from? either from a user-generated array like i said would need to be created, or from the cache’s item definitions (which is what i said to do, read data from cache > stream to server. | or just add the cache to the server and read it server sided.

[quote author=Driman Rune link=topic=643573.msg4332254#msg4332254 date=1373828819]
So should I just edit the file the items.txt are from and do this"

if (c.member) = true;
blah blah(“data/playeractions/items.txt”);
else if (c.member) = false;
blah blah("data/playeractions/freetoplayitems.txt);

something like that???
[/quote]if you’re creating two worlds, you don’t need 2 files.

member worlds: item configuration contains bonuses for all items.
free worlds: item configuration contains only bonuses for free-to-play items[/quote]

members flag is sent upon login, item definitions have a members flag, there should not be any more modifications needed other than bonuses.
